race.name: KowTown Gravel
race.tagline: KowTown Gravel. 60 miles of gravel through Kremmling.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Colorado Rockies. Significant elevation with mountain scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional CO event. Mountain terrain with remote location, high altitude, and small regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: KowTown Gravel is a regional event in Colorado—mountain terrain with significant elevation and high altitude. The Colorado Rockies are scenic, but the small regional field, remote location, and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional CO mountain gravel race. Worth it for CO/Mountain West riders. Not worth traveling far for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to CO—yes, it's solid. If you're traveling—skip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better CO races: Crooked Gravel, Wild Horse Gravel, Bighorn Gravel.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Kremmling has limited lodging. Plan ahead or stay in nearby towns.
logistics.food: Kremmling has limited dining. Stock nutrition.
logistics.camping:
camping check-in (Friday): **5:00 PM – 7:00 PM**[6]
Packet pickup (Saturday morning): **6:30 AM – 9:00 AM**[6]

Course start tim

course_description.signature_challenge: Colorado Rockies mountain terrain at high altitude.

non_negotiables.why: Colorado Rockies require sustained mountain effort.
Limited aid stations and remote location require self-sufficiency.

marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Regional event with mountain terrain and high altitude.

logistics.explanation: Parking split between West Grand High School and a separate K-8 lot suggests tight space management in a small town. On-site camping and packet pickup streamlines race morning, but rural Kremmling means limited lodging options and long drives from Denver. Course permitting uncertainty until race time is amateur hour.

length.explanation: The Bull at 88 miles with long climbs hits the sweet spot for serious gravel riders, while the Cow at 54 miles delivers what organizers call 'big views, fast gravel, and enough elevation to keep you honest.' The Calf at 28 miles and Cow Dog at 16 miles show they understand not everyone needs equal suffering. Good range across commitment levels. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Course descriptions promise 'long climbs, sun-baked gravel flats, and technical descents that demand respect' on the Bull, with 'hard-packed county roads, doubletrack, punchy climbs' throughout. Laura Wisner notes the roads 'are so smooth around here' but warns when it 'got a little chunky, well, I hope your bike handling's up to the challenge.' Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds.

elevation.explanation: The Bull climbs 10,000 feet over 88 miles through rolling mountain terrain, while the Cow delivers 5,500 feet over 54 miles. Course descriptions emphasize 'punchy climbs' and elevation that will 'keep you honest.' That's sustained climbing work through Colorado high country without being crushing by Rockies standards. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 75°F and lows of 41°F, with a 47% chance of rain on any given day. June in Kremmling means exposure on those 'sun-baked gravel flats' the organizers warn about, plus afternoon thunderstorm potential at 8,000+ feet elevation. The course runs through 'wide-open ranch country' where weather changes fast and shelter is scarce. No historical weather guidance provided for planning purposes. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Kremmling sits around 8,000 feet with climbs heading higher into thin-air territory through rolling mountain terrain. That's enough altitude to matter for sea-level riders but not debilitating like some Colorado events. Laura Wisner notes you can 'go for miles and miles and hours and hours' on Boulder County gravel at similar elevations. Similar altitude considerations to Grinduro.

adventure.explanation: Remote ranchlands, rolling mountains, and 85% gravel through BLM territory delivers Colorado backcountry experience. The 'untapped and untamed' marketing actually matches the terrain description for once. Long climbs and technical descents in high-altitude ranch country provides real adventure, not manufactured difficulty.

prestige.explanation: Now in its fourth year with $5,000 in prize money split between top five men and women on the Bull course. Limited to 750 riders and serves as a fundraiser for the community gym floor in Kremmling. Still very much a grassroots Colorado event without documented pro field or major gravel scene recognition.

race_quality.explanation: Course distances have shifted each year—Bull went from 90 to 100 to 88 miles across three editions, suggesting ongoing route development. Organizers promise 'aid stations are well stocked, signage is clear, and on-course support has you covered,' but operational consistency remains unproven for a young event still finding its footing.

experience.explanation: You get camping at West Grand High School, a spaghetti dinner, and finish line BBQ with live music — classic grassroots formula. Free showers and bike wash from 1-5 PM post-race shows they're thinking about the basics. But 'rave reviews about routes and community' without a single actual quote or race report suggests the experience is more hype than substance.

community.explanation: Small-town Colorado trying hard with camping, community expo, and family-friendly BBQ vibes. They moved the finish from West Grand High School to Kremmling Town Square shows they're engaging the actual town. But this is year four and still feels like a local church fundraiser with bikes.

field_depth.explanation: Prize money goes to top five overall men and women on the Bull course, but no past winner names or competitive results surface in available race reports. The 750-rider cap suggests decent participation, but this remains a weekend warrior and bucket-list event without documented competitive depth or notable gravel scene participants. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Early bird Bull at $130 includes race entry, meal tickets, camping, Friday spaghetti dinner, free showers, and bike wash for 88 miles of Colorado mountain gravel. That's solid value for a weekend camping trip with 10,000 feet of climbing. Standard pricing jumps to $155, which pushes but doesn't break the threshold for the region.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $80-100. On-site camping eliminates hotel costs in tourist country where lodging gets expensive fast. Free post-race meals, Friday spaghetti dinner, and bike wash reduce additional spending. Kremmling isn't a destination dining scene, so meal costs stay reasonable beyond what's included. Biggest expense is reaching rural Colorado from population centers. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: IRC Boken Double Cross
primary.why: Underrated mixed-terrain tire. Fast center with confident shoulder grip.

primary.name: Pirelli Cinturato Gravel M
primary.why: Mixed-terrain specialist. Balanced grip and speed for variable conditions.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: KowTown Gravel course preview 2023 in Kremmling, Colorado
videos.description:
KowTown Gravel is a brand new gravel race in Kremmling, Colorado. 

Held July 1, 2023, KowTown Gravel offers three distances, a wealth of Colorado high-country beauty, and the small-town hospitality of Kremmling, including that of race co-promoters the Scholl family who own Big Shooter Coffee. 

Get all the route information and register at https://www.kowtowngravel.com/

Big thanks to Josh Ben Bernales, Scott Van der Linden, Stephanie Scholl and everyone who helped pull this video together - and to Grandma Pat Scholl for the ranch burgers!

---
The Ride is supported in 2023 by:

Castelli clothing: https://www.castelli-cycling.com
Giro helmets: https://www.giro.com
Feedback Sports stands & tools: https://www.feedbacksports.com

videos.curation_reason: Comprehensive course preview with specific terrain details and elevation information for the inaugural event.

videos.title: Why KowTown Gravel is one of my favorite events
videos.description:
Way up in Grand County, Colorado, Blane Day and the Scholl family put on a high-altitude gravel race that climbs mountains, crosses the Colorado River, circumnavigates a reservoir and goes straight through the Scholl ranch.

You'll guaranteed to see a lot of cows, but hardly any vehicles.

Have you done KowTown Gravel yet? If not, go check it out! And make sure to get an Electric Fence at Big Shooters.

https://www.kowtowngravel.com/

https://www.visitgrandcounty.com/

--
Want to see what I'm testing and where? Follow me
on Strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/ben-delaney
or on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ben_delaney

--
The Ride is supported in 2025 by:
Castelli clothing: https://www.castelli-cycling.com/US/en/
HOVERAir autonomous drones: https://hoverair.com/
Perc coffee: https://tinyurl.com/fjr7nurr (save 15% with code 'ride15')
Saris racks: https://saris.com/collections/racks# (save 15% with code 'ben15')
Silca maintenance: https://bit.ly/47xxvzj (save 10% with code 'theridewithben10')
BikeTiresDirect: https://tinyurl.com/yc7vxujh (save 10% with code 'THERIDE') 
The Cyclist Lawyer: https://www.thecyclist-lawyer.com/
Shimano shoes & glasses: http://tinyurl.com/ye274tep
Feedback Sports stands & tools: https://bit.ly/3S9Dq8r

after after the little climb we made you
go through. So, we've got aid station at
the top of Grouse, the big climb on the
long. Yeah, for the long course, the
bull course, they'll be it's and that's
at 10,000. And then the aid station here
will will uh be for the 68 and the the
cow and the bull course. Kind of a local
flare. We have some characters that'll
be up here
that like uh it's kind of like the
cowboy aid station. They all have a
little bit of an
agricultural
upbringing which is cool because you
know it's it's a whole another vibe for
them. They can't fathom that people
would actually ride a
bicycle 1,800 feet to get here. So, it's
kind of it's it's kind of it's kind of I
think it's neat because we're um we're
involving the whole community in this
event, people that have nothing to do
with cycling. So, I think it's I think
that's that that helps everyone maybe
understand everybody else a little
better. Agreed. And conversely, for a
lot of gravel races, I don't know the
exact breakdown of your registration
list, but many of us are coming from
cities and towns where we're not
interacting with wrenchers on a
day-to-day basis, at least beyond just
like passing each other on the road. So,
stopping and and enjoying a Snickers bar
together. So, yeah. And they like it
because they actually get to visit with
these folks. And there's, you know,
we'll have people from all over the
country here. And I think our median age
for this race last year we had almost
670 670 folks and the average age was
probably 52 53. So it's an older
demographic for sure. We had you know
it's it's going to be a challenge
certainly for anyone coming from sea
level. But just slow down, take in the
view and enjoy the aid station. Plenty
of views to take in.
Lee, you've raced your bike all over the
world. What's it like riding bikes up
here in Grand County? I have and it is
amazing. Uh the vistas, the mountains,
the prairies, the plains, the cows, you
got it all here. All the things. What's
the What's the choice of rubber? You're
on the LA, you got plenty of clearance.
What would you recommend folks put on
for cow town? Yeah, I would say run at
least a 45 is what I would recommend. If
you can go bigger, even better. Uh there
are some steep climbs and a little loose
in sections, but for the most part, 45
and above, good to go. The surface
around here in Kremling that we've been
riding, it goes from champagne gravel to
a little bit of off-road MMR feel, a
little bit of a lowmaintenance road. Uh
shooter actually just carved this road
out on the course and got the tiller
out, got the cows going. So that's got
some nice fresh dirt. Uh there's also a
little bit of some chunkier
uh just loose rock, but for the most
part, you're going to encounter pretty
much everything on this course from
pavement to cow fields. As a guy who
lives here, what's what's the bike of
choice? What's the tire of choice? Well,
I'm riding a 2.1 Mscow cuz um I want to
be like Alex House when I grow up. You
know, the trend is to go a little bit
bigger, a little less air
pressure certainly.
Um, you could ride it on 40s,
but I would go a little wider. Tell us
about the courses if you would one by
one. So, the we'll start with the calf.
There's the calf, the cow, and the bull.
What is the calf course? So, the calf
course this year we modified it. We
shortened it a little, added a little
bit more gravel um without the big hard
gnarly climbs. Uh I think it has a
around
2300 ft of climbing. Then the cow
has 68 miles and it and we give you this
climb that goes up through the the the
ranch which is only open one time a year
for this event. And then of course the
bull we add in another uh 2500t climb up
Grouse Mountain before doing the the
last climb up through the ranch. So it
has
approximately 10,000 vert over almost
miles. Big thanks to the Grand County
Tourism Board for helping put on this
fine event. Visit Grand County is the
website and a good slogan. I encourage
you to come visit Grand County in July
5th. the date of cow town gravel this
year is a fine time to do so. I'll put
links to all the information you need in
the video description down below. Hope
that you can make up for the race. If
you're in a part of the world where that
just isn't in the cards, I hope that
watching the riding here has inspired
you to get out wherever you are and
enjoy the ride.
videos.curation_reason: Recent 2025 first-person experience from established cycling channel with detailed course and race atmosphere insights.

videos.title: Kowtown Gravel - best laid plans in Kremmling Colorado
videos.description:
I've been looking forward to Kowtown Gravel for weeks, months even. But sometimes, the universe just has something else in mind. Anyone that has seatpost recommendations, send them my way. I thoroughly enjoyed this adventure, start to finish, and I'm already looking forward to coming back next year so I can see what all I missed. Special thanks to Kowtown for partnering with us to give away an entry to this awesome event in 2024! Check out the No Coast Gravel Syndicate's video from Kowtown to see more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R49Zw4XSoWQ

Please support the companies that support us or we choose to represent at BOTGP!
https://ottawabikeandtrail.com  @ottawabikeandtrail   
https://orangemud.com  @Orangemud   
https://cantuwheels.com  @cantucyclingwheels7568  
https://altangletools.com/  @altanglecycling   
https://camelroofracks.com/  @ryanwilson2334   

Music in this episode includes:
Lars Eriksson - (Stay) True
Blood Red Sun - Fish on Land (Instrumental)
The Eastern Plain - In and Out of Love


#gravelcycling #surlybikes #gravel #coloradogravel

videos.curation_reason: Authentic first-person race recap showing real challenges and honest experience at the event.

videos.title: Rocky Mtn High: Revel Rover tested at Kowtown Gravel
videos.description:
Kowtown Gravel is a second-year event way up in Kremmling, Colorado, where the views are spectacular, the air is thin, and, yes, the cows are plentiful.

I took a Revel Rover from nearby Carbondale up to test it and myself. Spoiler alert: the bike fared better than I did!

--
Thanks to Alec Levy-O'Brien for the help shooting, driving, and laughing. 
--
The Ride is supported in 2024 by:
Castelli clothing: http://tinyurl.com/43k6pftp
Perc Coffee: https://tinyurl.com/etzyekwr (save 15% with code 'ride15')
Giro helmets: http://tinyurl.com/72svzzxp
Silca maintenance: https://bit.ly/47xxvzj (save 10% with code 'theride')
First Endurance nutrition: https://bit.ly/41SDgqq (save 20% with code 'THERIDE')
Shimano shoes & glasses: http://tinyurl.com/ye274tep
Feedback Sports stands & tools: https://bit.ly/3S9Dq8r
-
0:00 intro
0:33 bike overview
1:14 Kowtown experience
6:43 Revel & gear review

quotes.text: We have close to 200 head of cattle and the course runs right through the ranch - I'm looked at as a legitimate rancher that has a problem with aerobic exercise.
I'm riding the cow course 65 miles in total, 5,000 plus feet of climbing again at elevation - and I have learned not to push it at elevation, for me that's a death sentence on the day.

The 85 mile Bowl course has some 7,200 feet of climbing, takes us up almost to ten thousand feet, running alongside the Colorado River up past the Scholl family ranch seeing all their cattle out here this morning.
